alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Charles City, northeastern Prince George, northwestern York, south central New Kent, James City, and northern Surry Counties, the northern City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 400 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holdcroft to Rustic to near Garysville. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rustic around 315 PM EDT. Toano and Cabin Point around 340 PM EDT. Claremont, Norge and Jamestown around 345 PM EDT. Surry, Scotland and Kings Point around 350 PM EDT. Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Busch Gardens, Elberon, Grove and Fort Eustis around 400 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Taylors Corner, Chickahominy Shore, Chippokes State Park, Camp Peary, Spring Grove, Lanexa, Ewell, Poolesville, Warren Mill and Hog Island Game Reserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry; York
